citation.article-title: Flectobacillus roseus sp. nov., isolated from freshwater in Taiwan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flectobacillus roseus sp. nov.
Flectobacillus roseus (ro.se′us. L. masc. adj. roseus rose-coloured, pink).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-motile, straight rods (0.3–0.5 μm in diameter and 1.5–2.5 μm in length).
Accumulation of poly-β-hydroxybutyrate granules is not observed.
Colonies on R2A agar are pale pink to rose coloured, circular (1.5–2.5 mm in diameter), convex and smooth with entire margins.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C and pH 7–8; optimal temperature and pH for growth are 30 °C and pH 7.
Good growth is observed on R2A and nutrient agar without NaCl or with 0.5 % (w/v) NaCl; no growth is seen in the presence of 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl or on MacConkey agar.
Flexirubin-type pigments are not detected.
Positive for catalase and oxidase.
Negative for DNase and lipase (corn oil), and hydrolysis of Tweens 20, 40, 60, 80 and skimmed milk.
Hydrolysis of starch is strain specific.

Positive reactions (API 20NE) are seen for β-glucosidase and β-galactosidase, but negative reactions for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose acidification, arginine dihydrolase, urease, protease, and assimilation of glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate, citrate and phenyl acetate.

Positive enzyme reactions (API ZYM) are seen for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase; negative enzyme reactions are seen for lipase (C14) and β-glucuronidase.
Enzyme reactions for α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are strain specific.

The following compounds are utilized in the API 50 CH test system: d-arabinose, d-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, aesculin, d-salicin, cellobiose, maltose, d-lactose, α-melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, α-melezitose, α-raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, turanose and 5-ketogluconate.

Negative for assimilation of glycerol, erythritol, d-ribose, l-xylose, adonitol, l-sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate and 2-ketogluconate.
Utilization of the remaining substrates (l-fucose, l-arabinose, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine and amygdalin) is strain specific.

The following compounds are oxidized in the Biolog GN II test system: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, cellobiose, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, d-psicose, raffinose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, dl-lactic acid, l-alaninamide, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, uridine and α-d-glucose 1-phosphate.

The following compounds are not oxidized: Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, i-erythritol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, xylitol, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, d-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, glucuronamide, d-alanine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-serine, l-serine, l-threonine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol and dl-α-glycerol phosphate.
Sensitive to tetracycline, rifampicin, gentamicin, penicillin G, chloramphenicol, nalidixic acid, novobiocin, streptomycin, ampicillin, and sulfamethoxazole plus trimethoprim.
Resistant to kanamycin.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 1ω5c and iso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 39.7 mol%.
The type strain, GFA-11T (=BCRC 17834T=LMG 24501T), was isolated from a fish culture pond, Taoyuan County, northern Taiwan.
RG-4, isolated from a freshwater spring, Pingtung County, southern Taiwan, is a second strain of the species.
